TopicTitle: An Idea for making Multiple Star Systems (The devs should consider this too)

Articles.Content:
So, we've tried making companions to Kerbol. Too ugly and unrealistic, I say!

We've also tried making Kerbol a black hole and having stars orbit that. Too unrealistic, I say!

And don't even get me started on randomizing the Kerbol system...

The true way it should be done is this:

Forget adding to Kerbol. Instantiate an entirely new star system completely separate from Kerbol, that can only be accessed by getting a warp drive. When you reach a Kraken-causing altitude, pop up a menu selecting a star system to go to. When you select the new star system, it teleports you to it.

No, Kerbol still exists in the background. Time will still pass in there. This new system is literally made by coding half the game again.
This is a bad idea. Ignoring the fact there's already mods, coding more and more solar systems will make this game unplayable.
There is a mod that does exactly this. Kerbal Warp Drive.

> 
> This is a bad idea. Ignoring the fact there's already mods, coding more and more solar systems will make this game unplayable.

Not if everything in them is unloaded except for the passage of time.

> There is a mod that does exactly this. Kerbal Warp Drive.

It needs to make truly random planets, actually rename them, and work in 0.90.
I think you just want space engine to fuse with ksp. Not that that would be a bad thing.
